{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is asking about the characteristic feature of the outer membrane of a peripheral nerve. The outer membrane of a nerve is also known as the cell membrane or axolemma. According to Document [22], the cell membrane controls the movement of substances in and out of cells and organelles, being selectively permeable. This means it allows certain ions to pass through while blocking others.
